text.tspan: GAME UI scenes, which are used
for part of a game in-progress.

flowRoot.flowPara: GUEST UI scenes, which are shown to an individual player and can display different information to different players.
HOST UI scenes, which are displayed to all players at once
Implement the method initialize(<params>), which is called after the UI object is added to the tree. The parameters which this method takes vary depending on the type and role of the UI.
Implement the method pre_destroy(), which is called just before the UI object is removed from the tree as part of a UI change. It is called with no parameters.
The process for loading a UI scene depends on the type of UI scene which is to be loaded.

GAME UI scenes can only be loaded while a game is in-progress (this can usually be assumed from context, but if it must be checked, call $/root/Client.game_in_progress(). To load a scene, call $/root/Client.ui_change(path_to_new_ui), where path_to_new_ui is the resource path to the new UI object's scene. /root/Client will then unload the current UI and replace it with the new one.

CORE UI scenes can be loaded at any time. They are loaded through a similar process to GAME scenes, but using the ui_change_raw() function. The arguments to be passed to the UI's initialize() function must be provided to the ui_change_raw() function (as an array).
Implement initialize() to take exactly two parameters: the SingleClient node representing the player, and a Game-type node representing the current active game. The final method signature should be:
UI scene files should be placed within an appropriate directory within the project - for CORE UI scenes, this is /UI, and for GAME UI scenes, this is /Game/<game_title>/UI.

Files should be named according to role. For example, the Morning Meeting UI for Lizzness would be two separate scenes - one to be shown to all players (HOST role), and the other to be shown to each player individually (GUEST role). This is a GAME scene, so the files are located at
